greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Consider the triangle in A004736, the k-th term of the n-th row is the LCM of the preceding k terms.
link: Enrique Pérez Herrero, Rows n=1..100 of triangle, flattened.
example: T(5,3) = 60 because the fifth row of A004736 has the terms {5 4 3 2 1 }, the first three terms being 5, 4 & 3 which have an LCM of 60.
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := LCM @@ Drop[Reverse[Range[n]], (k - n)]; Flatten[ Table[ T[n, k], {n, 11}, {k, n}]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 27 2004 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 25 2004
ext: Edited by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 27 2004
